question: 100 g of ice at <katex>$0^{\circ}C$</katex> is mixed with 100 g of water at <katex>$100^{\circ}C$</katex>. The final temperature of the mixture is [Take <katex>$L_{f}=3.36\times10^{5}J~kg^{-1}$</katex> and <katex>$S_{w}=4.2\times10^{3}J~kg^{-1}k^{-1}]$</katex>
explanation: Heat released by water to reach <katex>$0^{\circ}C$</katex>: <katex>$Q_1 = ms\Delta T = 0.1 \times 4200 \times 100 = 42000$</katex> J. Heat required to melt ice: <katex>$Q_2 = mL = 0.1 \times 336000 = 33600$</katex> J. Remaining heat <katex>$42000 - 33600 = 8400$</katex> J heats the total mass (200g). <katex>$8400 = (0.2) \times 4200 \times T$</katex>. <katex>$8400 = 840 T$</katex>. <katex>$T = 10^{\circ}C$</katex>.
